intro: Chaerophyllum orientale, commonly known as the Eastern cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. The species is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued as a decorative plant in gardens.
